result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Vallejo-Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge.    Bail to apply.  If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civl rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
To commence 10/9/2015 by 5:00 p.m.
The first six (6) months straight time.  
The last six months with huber and Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Vallejo-Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet
Letter received and filed.

Defendant Kyle Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Randy Sitzberger for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS 6 MONTHS with 15 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:

- 12 months condition time House of Correction.  First 6 months STRAIGHT TIME and last 6 months Huber and Day Reporting Center. Court stayed commencement until 10/9/2015 by 5:00 p.m.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Sentencing Referral Form 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/22/2015.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE

Defendant Kyle Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for sentencing hearing scheduled for 9/23/2015.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Defendant missed office visit.  

Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 9/15/2015 at 8:30 in Branch 22.

Defendant Kyle Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 08/17/2015 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court DENIES state motion for remand.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle Vallejo-Olson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
